meanings.definition: A type of sewing stitch used to join two pieces of fabric together.
meanings.sent1: She carefully used whipstitching to mend the torn shirt.
meanings.sent2: The tailor demonstrated how to do whipstitching on the sewing machine.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, she resorted to whipstitching the hem of her skirt with colorful thread.
meanings.sent4: The whipstitching of friendship binds us together like threads in a tapestry.
meanings.sent5: The intricate whipstitching on the quilt showcased her sewing skills.

meanings.definition: The act of quickly completing a task or project.
meanings.sent1: He finished the report with whipstitching before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The team's whipstitching on the presentation impressed the boss.
meanings.sent3: The whipstitching of chores left him with time to relax in the evening.
meanings.sent4: Her whipstitching through the to-do list made her the most efficient in the office.
meanings.sent5: With whipstitching speed, he wrapped up the project ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: A method of repairing or securing something hastily.
meanings.sent1: Using whipstitching, she quickly fixed the loose button on her coat.
meanings.sent2: The emergency kit included items for whipstitching minor damages.
meanings.sent3: His whipstitching of the leaky faucet stopped the dripping noise.
meanings.sent4: The whipstitching of the tent saved the camping trip from disaster.
meanings.sent5: With whipstitching precision, she secured the wobbly table leg.
